docs.lead_paragraph: Free condoms from the International AIDS Conference in Toronto, stuffed into all my bags as gifts for friends, turned the routine trip home to New York into an adventure.

headline.main: And You Think That You Worry About Your Bags Spilling Open

headline.main: An African Tale to Break Your Heart (6 Letters)
headline.print_headline: An African Tale to Break Your Heart

docs.lead_paragraph: Readers respond to articles in Science Times with thoughts on Morgellons disease, ocean life, nausea and more.
docs.snippet: Readers respond to articles in Science Times with thoughts on Morgellons disease, ocean life, nausea and more.

docs.lead_paragraph: To the Editor: Re ''Nausea? There's No Need to Suffer in Silence'' (Oct. 24): Jane E. Brody reports that pregnancy sickness afflicts most women and reduces miscarriage. These are signs of a normal biological adaptation.
docs.abstract: Glenn Weisfeld letter on Jane E Brody October 24 Personal Health column on nausea suggests that pregnant women should not take anti-nausea medication; drawing
docs.snippet: To the Editor:     Re ''Nausea? There's No Need to Suffer in Silence'' (Oct. 24): Jane E. Brody reports that pregnancy sickness afflicts most women and reduces miscarriage. These are signs of a normal biological adaptation.

docs.lead_paragraph: To the Editor: Re ''Africa's World of Forced Labor, in a 6-Year-Old's Eyes'' (front page, Oct. 29): The story and photographs of Mark Kwadwo, the 6-year-old who is indentured to a fisherman in Ghana, are heartbreaking.

headline.main: An African Tale to Break Your Heart

docs.abstract: Six letters comment on Oct 29 article about indentured children in Africa; Ann Malaspina describes story as wrenching; Rachel Balkcom says story left her feeling powerless; Kitth Hsu Dana describes being overcome with sadness and feels shame that America falls short of its obligation for global leadership; Elizabeth Madrigal cites early childbirth as root of problem; Donald Wyner calls upon UN Secretary General Kofi Annan to use pressure to end child labor; Jane Roberts blames gender inequality and forcing girls into early marriages and childbearing; drawing
docs.snippet: To the Editor:      Re ''Africa's World of Forced Labor, in a 6-Year-Old's Eyes'' (front page, Oct. 29):     The story and photographs of Mark Kwadwo, the 6-year-old who is indentured to a fisherman in Ghana, are heartbreaking.

docs.lead_paragraph: By virtue of Southern California’s stunning 33-31 defeat at Oregon State on Saturday, West Virginia replaced the Trojans in third place in the latest B.C.S. standings.

headline.main: Next Hurdle in B.C.S. Race Is Showdown in the Big East
headline.sub: West Virginia Rises to No. 3, but Louisville Awaits ;

docs.snippet: By virtue of Southern California’s stunning 33-31 defeat at Oregon State on Saturday, West Virginia replaced the Trojans in third place in the latest B.C.S. standings.
